excerpt: Art museum focused on the state of Rio Grande do Sul, also offering a cafe, book store & gift shop.
detail_description: The Rio Grande do Sul Museum of Art is a must-visit attraction in the state, showcasing the works of regional artists. Housed in a neoclassical building, it stands out amidst modern architecture. The museum has been a prominent venue for local artists since its establishment in 1954 and relocation to its current location in the late 1970s. Visitors can also enjoy amenities such as a cafe, book store, and gift shop on-site.
name: Rio Grande do Sul Museum of Art
address: Praça da Alfândega, s/n - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-150, Brazil

excerpt: A historic theater with elegant décor hosting musicals, concerts & more on stage since 1858.
detail_description: The São Pedro Theatre, established in 1858, is the oldest theater in Porto Alegre. Its neoclassical architecture and high ceilings create an elegant setting for a variety of performances including musicals and concerts. The theater has been a venue for major shows in the city and is particularly popular during events like Porto Alegre em Cena and Porto Verao Alegre.
name: São Pedro Theatre
address: Praça Mal. Deodoro, S/N - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-300, Brazil

excerpt: Porto Alegre is the capital city of the state of Rio Grande do Sul, in southern Brazil. On the main square, Praça Marechal Deodoro, is the Renaissance-style Metropolitan Cathedral, with religious murals on the outside. The neoclassical Piratini Palace houses the state government. The 19th-century São Pedro Theater is nearby. The city is known as a gateway to the tall canyons of Aparados da Serra National Park.
detail_description: Porto Alegre, the capital city of Rio Grande do Sul in southern Brazil, boasts architectural gems like the Metropolitan Cathedral and Piratini Palace. It serves as a gateway to the stunning canyons of Aparados da Serra National Park. Despite not being on the coast, it offers maritime activities through its large port along Baier de Guaiba.
name: Porto Alegre
address: RS, Brazil

excerpt: Landmark built in 1869 with 100+ vendors selling crafts, produce, snacks, plants & more.
detail_description: The Porto Alegre Public Market, established in 1869, is a historic landmark featuring over 100 vendors offering a wide array of goods such as crafts, produce, snacks, and plants. It's a must-visit destination in the city along with other attractions like the Usina do Gasometro cultural center and scenic spots like Marinha do Brasil Park and Farroupilha Park. The market is known for its Brazilian food and crafts.
name: Porto Alegre Public Market
address: Largo Jorn. Glênio Péres, 1 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90020-050, Brazil

detail_description: Parque Farroupilha, also known as "Redencao," is a cherished urban park in Porto Alegre, Brazil. With over a century of history, it's a green oasis spanning approximately 37 hectares and serves as a popular gathering and leisure spot for locals and visitors alike. On Sunday mornings, the park hosts a bustling market offering an authentic experience of local culture and cuisine. It's an ideal place for leisurely walks, communing with nature, and engaging in conversations.
name: Parque farroupilha
address: Santana, Porto Alegre - RS, 90040-190, Brazil

excerpt: Outdoor retreat offering an auditorium, market, paddle boats, snack bars & lots of trees.
detail_description: Parque Redenção, also known as Parque da Redencao or Farroupilha Park, is a historic and beloved urban park in Porto Alegre. Established in 1935 to commemorate the end of slavery in the city, it offers a tranquil retreat with lush green lawns, over 10,000 trees of various species, an auditorium, market, paddle boats and snack bars.
name: Parque Redenção
address: Av. João Pessoa - Farroupilha, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-150, Brazil

excerpt: Unique, large building offering a variety of artistic programming, plus a coffee house & gift shop.
detail_description: Casa de Cultura Mario Quintana (CCMQ) is a unique and spacious building that offers a diverse range of artistic events, along with a charming coffee house and gift shop. Situated in the historic downtown area, it is surrounded by significant landmarks such as the Public Market, Town Hall, Memorial do Rio Grande do Sul, and MARGS. The Casa de Cultura Mario Quintana was once the residence of poet Mario Quintana and has been transformed into a cultural center.
name: Casa de Cultura Mario Quintana (CCMQ)
address: R. dos Andradas, 736 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90020-004, Brazil

excerpt: Affluent Moinhos de Vento surrounds a busy park of the same name, with sports fields and a lake, as well as a eucalyptus log playground and replica 18th-century windmill. Shopping Moinhos is an upmarket, multistory mall featuring a cinema and fashion boutiques, while designer stores, craft breweries, and gourmet cafes sit on tree-lined streets among historic villas and high-end residential developments.
detail_description: Moinhos de Vento is an affluent neighborhood in Porto Alegre, known for its bustling park with sports fields, a lake, and a replica 18th-century windmill. The area also boasts the upmarket Shopping Moinhos, a multistory mall offering a cinema and fashion boutiques. Tree-lined streets are dotted with designer stores, craft breweries, and gourmet cafes amidst historic villas and high-end residential developments.
name: Moinhos de Vento
address: Porto Alegre - RS, Brazil

detail_description: Usina do Gasômetro, located in Praca da Alfandega, is a former gas plant transformed into a vibrant cultural center in Porto Alegre. The 1920s neo-classic buildings around it have been converted into museums and community spaces. Visitors can enjoy boat tours with stunning city views from the water. The interactive Science and Technology Museum offers hair-raising displays and fun experiments for all ages.
name: Usina do Gasômetro
address: Cais do Porto, Largo do Trabalho, 46 - Cais do Porto, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-510, Brazil

detail_description: Estádio Beira-Rio, also known as the Giant, is a 50,000-seat soccer stadium located in Porto Alegre. It has been the stage for intense matches between the city's two soccer teams, Sport Club Internacional and Grêmio. Situated by the Guaíba River, it boasts a prime location and was even outfitted with billowing white sails around its exterior for its hosting duties during the 2014 World Cup.
name: Estádio Beira-Rio
address: Av. Padre Cacique, 891 - Praia de Belas, Porto Alegre - RS, 90810-240, Brazil

excerpt: Green space offering athletic fields, a kids' library, a pond & a replica of an Azorean windmill.
detail_description: Parque Moinhos de Vento, affectionately referred to as Parcao by locals, is a beloved urban park in Porto Alegre. Spanning 11.5 hectares, this tranquil and welcoming space offers a rich history dating back to 1972 and a variety of activities for visitors to enjoy. From running and skating areas to soccer, tennis, and volleyball courts, the park caters to sports enthusiasts.
name: Parque Moinhos de Vento (Parcão)
address: R. Comendador Caminha, s/n - Moinhos de Vento, Porto Alegre - RS, 90430-030, Brazil

detail_description: Praça da Alfândega is a vibrant square in Porto Alegre, known for its cultural and commercial attractions. It houses various museums, shops, and a shopping center, offering a diverse range of handicrafts and regional products. The annual book fair takes place here, drawing book enthusiasts from all over.
name: Praça da Alfândega
address: Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90020-006, Brazil

detail_description: Located in the coastal Parque Moacyr Scliar, 360 POA Gastrobar is a futuristic-looking restaurant with large glass windows offering stunning 360-degree views of the area. It's situated on the lake of Guaiba and provides a perfect spot to enjoy breathtaking sunsets. The contemporary southern cuisine emphasizes premium meats and mostly organic ingredients. Visitors can also enjoy live music at sunset, making it a romantic and relaxing experience.
name: 360 POA Gastrobar
address: Av. Pres. João Goulart, 551 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-120, Brazil

detail_description: Gremio Arena, located in Porto Alegre, is a modern and impressive stadium that has hosted numerous remarkable matches over the years. It is the home of Gremio, one of Brazil's most traditional football teams. The arena has seen famous players like Ronaldo and Zidane competing in the Match Against Poverty in 2012, as well as showcase matches between Brazil and France.
name: Arena do Grêmio
address: Av. Padre Leopoldo Brentano, 110 - Farrapos, Porto Alegre - RS, 90250-590, Brazil

excerpt: 39-hectare garden with native trees & flowers from Rio Grande do Sul, paths, lakes & picnic areas.
detail_description: The Botanical Gardens of Porto Alegre cover a vast 39-hectare area and are renowned for their collection of native trees and flowers from Rio Grande do Sul. The garden offers visitors a tranquil escape with its scenic ponds, themed gardens, and walking trails. It is home to a diverse range of plant species including orchids, bromeliads, and cacti.
name: Botanical Gardens of Porto Alegre
address: R. Dr. Salvador França, 1427 - Jardim Botânico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90690-000, Brazil

excerpt: Known for its tunnel of trees, this quaint street is lined with historic buildings & colorful homes.
detail_description: R. Gonçalo de Carvalho - Independência is a charming street famous for its tunnel of trees and lined with historic buildings and colorful homes. It has been rightfully recognized as one of the most beautiful streets in the world and is considered a national pride. The street is adorned with trees of genus Tipuana, planted in the 1930s, which still gracefully embrace the sidewalk.
name: R. Gonçalo de Carvalho - Independência
address: Porto Alegre - RS, 90035-170, Brazil

excerpt: Small airport offering varied restaurants & shops, plus a post office.
detail_description: Salgado Filho International Airport, located about 5.5 miles from Porto Alegre, Brazil, offers a variety of restaurants and shops for travelers to enjoy. Visitors have praised the airport's accessibility and cleanliness, as well as its diverse food selection. Some have noted the disappointment of the duty-free shop not offering local products. The airport also features amenities such as free WiFi, clean restrooms, and comfortable waiting areas.
name: Porto Alegre–Salgado Filho International Airport
address: Av. Severo Dullius, 90.010 - Anchieta, Porto Alegre - RS, 90200-310, Brazil

excerpt: A bustling, casual diner that serves daily specials, an array of sandwiches & fresh juices.
detail_description: Lancheria do Parque is a popular and lively diner located in the Bom Fim neighborhood, right across from Parque Redencao. It's a favorite spot for locals, families, young people, musicians, and even seniors who come to enjoy its typically Porto Alegre experience. The menu offers a variety of affordable sandwiches, daily specials, and à la carte dishes. Additionally, there's an option for buffet dining throughout the day.
name: Lancheria do Parque
address: Av. Osvaldo Aranha, 1086 - Bom Fim, Porto Alegre - RS, 90035-191, Brazil

detail_description: Bistrô do MARGS, established in 1954, is the main art museum in the state of Rio Grande do Sul and one of the most significant in Brazil. Its collection comprises over 5,000 artworks spanning from the first half of the 19th century to contemporary pieces, encompassing various visual arts languages such as painting, sculpture, printmaking, ceramics, drawing, textile art, photography, installation, performance, digital art and design.
name: Bistrô do MARGS
address: Praça da Alfândega - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-150, Brazil

excerpt: Bordering huge Farroupilha Park, Cidade Baixa is a renowned nightlife area where cocktail bars, nightclubs, and live music venues sit beside trendy Mediterranean and Asian eateries, steakhouses, and burger bars. The Joaquim Felizardo Museum displays local archaeological finds and decorative objects, plus thousands of old photographs, and the Casa Baka hosts contemporary art exhibitions in a landmark 1930s building.
detail_description: Cidade Baixa is a vibrant neighborhood known for its lively nightlife and diverse dining options. It's home to cocktail bars, nightclubs, live music venues, trendy Mediterranean and Asian eateries, steakhouses, and burger bars. The area also boasts cultural attractions such as the Joaquim Felizardo Museum with local archaeological finds and old photographs, as well as the Casa Baka which hosts contemporary art exhibitions in a historic 1930s building.
name: Cidade Baixa
address: Porto Alegre - RS, Brazil

excerpt:
Farroupilha is a neighbourhood in the city of Porto Alegre, the state capital of Rio Grande do Sul, in Brazil. It was created by Law 2022 from December 7, 1959.
Farroupilha Park, the most popular in town, is located here, as well as part of the Central Campus of the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul. Wikipedia.
detail_description: Farroupilha is a neighborhood situated in Porto Alegre, the capital of Rio Grande do Sul, Brazil. Established by Law 2022 in 1959, it is home to the renowned Farroupilha Park and part of the Federal University of Rio Grande do Sul's Central Campus. Residents enjoy unwinding at Marinha do Brasil Park and Farroupilha Park's lush green spaces.
name: Farroupilha
address: Porto Alegre - RS, Brazil

excerpt: Chic, modern museum devoted to artist Iberê Camargo, showcasing his work in a simple, white space.
detail_description: Nestled along the scenic banks of the Guaíba River, the Fundação Iberê Camargo is a chic and contemporary museum dedicated to celebrating the life and works of one of Brazil's most esteemed artists, Iberê Camargo. Established in 1995 by his widow, this modern space not only showcases an impressive collection of his art but also serves as a hub for artistic dialogue through various exhibitions, workshops, and seminars.
name: Fundação Iberê
address: Av. Padre Cacique, 2000 - Cristal, Porto Alegre - RS, 90810-240, Brazil

excerpt: Large city park featuring multiple sport courts, art, gymnastic equipment & 11 acres of trees.
detail_description: Park Marinha do Brasil, the largest park in Porto Alegre, is a sprawling urban oasis near the Guaiba River and Praia de Belas shopping mall. The park boasts 11 acres of native and exotic trees, including Ingas, Jambolao, and Jerivas. It's a popular spot for sports enthusiasts with its indoor soccer, tennis, volleyball, and basketball courts as well as skating rinks and cycling paths.
name: Park Marinha do Brasil
address: Av. Borges de Medeiros, 2035 - Menino Deus, Porto Alegre - RS, 90110-150, Brazil

excerpt: Stately museum, the oldest in Rio Grande do Sul, featuring art depicting the history of the state.
detail_description: This museum is a must-see for anyone visiting Porto Alegre, with a wealth of collections covering history, art, and culture from across Rio Grande do Sul. It's also free to visit, making it an ideal spot for a weekend getaway.
name: Museum Júlio de Castilhos
address: R. Duque de Caxias, 1205 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-281, Brazil

excerpt: Elegant, historic venue featuring local history exhibits, including traditional costumes & art.
detail_description: The Memorial do Rio Grande do Sul is a cultural center located in Porto Alegre, housed in a historic property at Alfandega Square. The building is listed as historical heritage and features local history exhibits, traditional costumes, and art. Visitors appreciate the elegant and spacious venue with an elevator for easy access to different floors of exhibitions. While the museum offers a good insight into the history of Rio Grande do Sul state, it's important to note that all information is available only in Portuguese.
name: Memorial do Rio Grande do Sul
address: R. Sete de Setembro, 1020 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-191, Brazil

excerpt: Stately cathedral with 2 bell towers, a 65-m. dome, colorful mosaic murals & other notable art.
detail_description: The Catedral Metropolitana de Porto Alegre is a stately cathedral known for its impressive architecture and design. Built in the 1920s, this historical site features two bell towers, a 65-meter dome, and colorful mosaic murals. While partially closed to visitors, the dome is now open for public viewing.
name: Catedral Metropolitana de Porto Alegre
address: R. Duque de Caxias, 1047 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-282, Brazil

detail_description: Araújo Vianna Auditorium is a fantastic venue for live music, located in a public park with convenient access to parking and public transportation. The area also offers plenty of dining and drinking options nearby, making it easy to grab a meal or drink before or after the show. Visitors have praised the well-organized and secure atmosphere, as well as the excellent acoustics for performances.
name: Araújo Vianna Auditorium
address: Parque Farroupilha, 685 - Farroupilha, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-150, Brazil

detail_description: Enigma Escape Game offers an immersive and engaging experience with challenging game rooms that quickly draw you into the action. Visitors highly recommend it, praising the great staff and amazing rooms. Despite the difficulty, players find it to be an incredible experience. The venue is considered one of the best escape games in Porto Alegre, offering fun challenges and a great time for groups of friends.
name: Enigma Escape Game
address: R. João Guimarães, 359 - Santa Cecília, Porto Alegre - RS, 90630-170, Brazil

excerpt: Imposing 19th-century Catholic church with a long stone staircase, twin spires & an ornate interior.
detail_description: Basílica Nossa Senhora das Dores is a grand Catholic church built in the 19th century, featuring an impressive stone staircase and twin spires. The interior is adorned with intricate decorations. This basilica can be found in various locations such as Portugal, the Azores, China, and Brazil. It is also known by different names including Church of Lady of Pain and Church of Holy Pain.
name: Basílica Nossa Senhora das Dores
address: R. dos Andradas, 587 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90020-006, Brazil

detail_description: The Monument to Laçador in the impressive capital city of Porto Alegre is a breathtaking symbol. This remarkable sculpture showcases the strength and elegance of its subject, capturing attention with its awe-inspiring presence. Its grandeur stands as a testament to the rich cultural heritage and artistic prowess of this vibrant city. The monument's magnificence commands admiration, drawing visitors from all over to witness its captivating beauty.
name: Monument to Laçador
address: Av. dos Estados, 1175 - Anchieta, Porto Alegre - RS, 90200-320, Brazil

detail_description: Hidráulica Moinhos de Vento is a picturesque green oasis nestled amidst the urban landscape. The well-preserved early twentieth-century architecture and stunning gardens offer a serene setting for relaxation. Visitors can enjoy leisurely moments with yerba mate or picnics, surrounded by lush lawns and captivating scenery. Additionally, the site features an art gallery housed in a former water reservoir and offers guided tours of the water treatment plant on select days.
name: Hidráulica Moinhos de Vento
address: R. 24 de Outubro, 200 - Independência, Porto Alegre - RS, 90510-001, Brazil

name: Estádio Olímpico Monumental
address: Medianeira, Porto Alegre - RS, 90450-190, Brazil

detail_description: Sanctuary Mother of God, also known as the Archdiocesan Shrine of Lady Mother of God, is a stunning Catholic church situated on Round Stone hill in Porto Alegre. This post-modern church offers breathtaking views of the city and countryside from its hilltop location. With glass walls on either end, visitors can enjoy a bright interior and panoramic vistas.
name: Sanctuary Mother of god
address: R. Santuário, 400 - Belém Velho, Porto Alegre - RS, 91712-701, Brazil

detail_description: Cultural-Historical Center Santa Casa is a small yet impressive theater that offers an exceptional and immersive show experience. It provides a great opportunity to witness captivating performances in an intimate setting, making it a must-visit for those seeking unique cultural experiences.
name: Cultural-Historical Center Santa Casa
address: Av. Independência, 75 - Independência, Porto Alegre - RS, 90035-072, Brazil

excerpt: Municipal park offering tennis, basketball & indoor soccer courts, plus walking paths & playgrounds.
detail_description: Parque Germânia, also known as Germania Park, is a municipal park located in the affluent East zone of Porto Alegre. Unlike other parks in the area, it has minimal tree cover and closes at night. However, it offers various sports amenities such as tennis courts, basketball and indoor soccer courts. The park is popular with locals on weekend afternoons and features generous free parking options.
name: Parque Germânia
address: Av. Túlio de Rose, s/n - Jardim Europa, Porto Alegre - RS, 91340-010, Brazil

excerpt: Sculptures, paintings & antiques in a landmark administrative palace built in the late 19th century.
detail_description: Nestled in the heart of Porto Alegre, Palácio Piratini stands as a stunning testament to late 19th-century architecture and serves as the seat of government for Rio Grande do Sul. This landmark is not just an administrative palace; it’s a treasure trove filled with exquisite sculptures, paintings, and antiques that reflect the region's rich history.
name: Palácio Piratini
address: Praça Mal. Deodoro, s/n - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90010-905, Brazil

detail_description: The Museu Militar do Comando Militar do Sul is a small but impressively curated museum with a focus on military history from Brazil. Admission is free and it's well worth the visit for any fan of military memorabilia. Highlights include armored vehicles and firearms from World War II and II, as well as photos, documents, and weaponry from all periods of Brazilian history.
name: Museu Militar do Comando Militar do Sul do Exército Brasileiro
address: R. dos Andradas, 630 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90020-002, Brazil

excerpt: River promenade with a bike path, sports facilities, playgrounds & restaurants, popular at sunset.
name: Parque Jaime Lerner (Orla do Guaíba)
address: Av. Edvaldo Pereira Paiva - Praia de Belas, Porto Alegre - RS, 45704-688, Brazil

detail_description: Instituto Ling boasts a stunning minimalist design and a tranquil, sound-isolated yet welcoming ambiance. The staff is known for their exceptional politeness and friendliness. The institute features captivating art installations and hosts a variety of public events, making it an inclusive space for all. Additionally, its coffee shop provides an excellent setting for productive business meetings.
name: Instituto Ling
address: R. João Caetano, 440 - Três Figueiras, Porto Alegre - RS, 90470-260, Brazil

detail_description: The escape room experience at Cinescape Escape Room was truly remarkable. The room featured an incredibly engaging storyline, which not only served as a backdrop for the escape but also formed the core of problem-solving. The puzzles were meticulously designed and challenging, requiring deep thinking and analysis. Additionally, the level of customer service provided was exceptional. It is evident that great care has been taken in creating an immersive and memorable experience for visitors.
name: Cinescape Escape Game
address: R. Pedro Chaves Barcelos, 475 - Mont'Serrat, Porto Alegre - RS, 90450-010, Brazil

excerpt: A modern theater with 1,500 numbered seats, a mezzanine, Italian stage & ticketing on site & online.
detail_description: Teatro do Sesi is a contemporary performance venue boasting a seating capacity of 1,500 and offering a wide range of cutting-edge productions. This theater features not only an Italian stage but also a mezzanine level, providing an elevated viewing experience for the audience. In addition to its physical box office, Teatro do Sesi offers the convenience of online ticketing services. Known for its top-notch performances, this cultural hub has gained recognition as one of the top ten theaters in the region.
name: Teatro do Sesi
address: Av. Assis Brasil, 8787 - Sarandi, Porto Alegre - RS, 91760-150, Brazil

name: Espaço Força e Luz
address: R. dos Andradas, 1223 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90020-008, Brazil

detail_description: The Planetarium of the UFRGS, Professor José Baptista Pereira is a beautiful place where you can learn about the Cosmos. It is great for children, friends or alone.
name: Planetário da UFRGS Professor José Baptista Pereira
address: Av. Ipiranga, 2000 - Santana, Porto Alegre - RS, 90160-091, Brazil

name: Inter Museum - Ruy Tedesco
address: Ao lado do, Av. Padre Cacique, 891 - Portão 7 - Praia de Belas, Porto Alegre - RS, 90810-240, Brazil

excerpt: Japanese-style garden featuring an ornamental pool & bridge, paths, a pavilion & flowering plants.
detail_description: Praça Província de Shiga, also known as Praça de Shiga, is a stunning Japanese-style garden located in the Higienopolis neighborhood. Once inside, visitors are transported to a serene oasis with an ornamental pool, bridge, pavilion, and blooming plants. Despite its small size, the park exudes charm and tranquility. However, it can get crowded on weekends with people using it for photo shoots.
name: Praça Província de Shiga
address: Av. Cristóvão Colombo, s/n - Passo d'Areia, Porto Alegre - RS, 90480-120, Brazil

detail_description: Located on the BR-290 highway, running east-west across the state, Lookout Morro Santa Teresa is a picturesque attraction connecting the northeastern coast of the state to the Uruguay-Argentina-Brazil border. Situated near the municipality's northern boundary, this scenic spot offers breathtaking views. As one approaches Porto Alegre from the west, BR-290 transforms into a high-quality freeway spanning 100 km (62 mi), providing convenient access to both the coastline and BR-101 highway.
name: Lookout Morro Santa Teresa
address: R. Corrêa Lima, 229 - Santa Tereza, Porto Alegre - RS, 90850-250, Brazil

name: Calçadão De Ipanema
address: Av. Guaíba, 818 - Ipanema, Porto Alegre - RS, 91760-740, Brazil

excerpt: An intimate theater with 200 numbered seats, a balcony, a mechanized stage & an on-site box office.
detail_description: Teatro Bruno Kiefer is an intimate venue that can accommodate 200 attendees, offering a numbered seating arrangement, a balcony, and a mechanized stage. This performing arts theater also has an on-site box office for convenient ticket purchases. It provides an excellent setting for small presentations and offers competitive pricing.
name: Teatro Bruno Kiefer
address: R. dos Andradas, 736 - Centro Histórico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90030-150, Brazil

detail_description: The Museu de Ciências Naturais da Fundação Zoobotânica do Rio Grande do Sul, located in the Porto Alegre Botanical Garden, has been dedicated to research, conservation, and education since 1955. Visitors can explore the Exhibition Room from Tuesday to Sunday and enjoy amenities such as parking and a lunch area. The museum is known for its important collection of materials from all over Brazil and its significant discoveries including fossils.
name: Museu de Ciências Naturais da Fundação Zoobotânica do Rio Grande do Sul
address: R. Dr. Salvador França, 1427 - Jardim Botânico, Porto Alegre - RS, 90690-000, Brazil

excerpt: Popular for events celebrating gaucho traditions, this park also has BBQ grills & water views.
detail_description: Parque Maurício Sirotsky Sobrinho, also known as Parque Harmonia, is a popular destination in Porto Alegre, particularly during the annual Acampamento Farroupilha event in September. This three-week celebration of gaucho culture and traditions commemorates the Ragamuffin War. The park spans over 300,000 square meters and offers a leisure area with BBQ grills and scenic water views.
name: Parque Maurício Sirotsky Sobrinho (Parque Harmonia)
address: Av. Loureiro da Silva, 255 - Praia de Belas, Porto Alegre - RS, 90050-240, Brazil
